meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>spicy</kanji> <kanji>hug</kanji> is a hug that feels not so great. But, it's not really painful all at once, either. As you're receiving a spicy hug, you just have to show <vocabulary>patience</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>endurance</vocabulary> while it lasts.
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji, but you haven't learned this for either 辛 or 抱 yet, so let's use a mnemonic to remember it: 

Think about how much <vocabulary>patience</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>endurance</vocabulary> your <reading>shin</reading>s (しん) need to have to be good at <reading>bo</reading>wling (ぼう). You won't get any strikes with weak shins!

Note that the ぼう reading is the rendaku'd reading for 抱.
